title: About KBG
mission: To promote interdisciplinary learning and innovation at the intersection of biology and engineering at IIT Mandi.
history: Found in 2022 by a small group of people dreaming to create a space for passion to explore and spread knowledge about 'What is Bioengineering?' Wanting to do something different from mainstream, they started KBG. Now, following their footsteps, KBG has grown bigger and better but with the same ambition and passion to explore life with the lens of technology.
aboutLong: Kamand Bioengineering Group (KBG) is an student club of IIT Mandi that brings together curious minds from across disciplines to explore the rapidly growing world of bioengineering. The club serves as a platform for students to learn, experiment, and innovate through hands-on projects, technical workshops, speaker sessions, and hackathons. Our focus areas span biotechnology, artificial intelligence, computational biology, biomimetics, bio-robotics, and environmental innovation. KBG strives to create an ecosystem that nurtures creativity, fosters research collaborations, and encourages responsible technological advancement in the life sciences.

features.title: Workshops
features.description: Hands-on technical sessions covering topics like bioinformatics, biosensing, biomimetic design, bio-AI integration, and computational modeling. These sessions are designed to equip students with practical, research-ready skills.

features.title: Projects
features.description: KBG supports interdisciplinary student-led projects combining biology with AI, electronics, and mechanical systems. Projects range from biosensing devices to optimization algorithms inspired by nature.

features.title: Speaker Sessions
features.description: Talks and interactions with researchers, innovators, and industry professionals who share insights into emerging trends and career paths in bioengineering and biotechnology.

features.title: Community Events
features.description: Interactive events, challenges, and hackathons like BioForge, AI+ series, and Cell Saga that encourage learning through creativity, teamwork, and real-world problem solving.

whatWeDo: Organize interdisciplinary workshops and training sessions
Host events and hackathons in bioengineering and AI
Promote hands-on student projects and innovation
Invite expert talks and mentorship sessions
Participation in international competitions in bio-tech fields
Foster a creative community of bioengineers and enthusiasts
